result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jared Michael McFee

defendant.name: McFee, Jared Michael

records.addlTxt: 1:00 PM Defendant Jared Michael McFee in court.  Attorney Daniel Francis Snyder in court for Jared Michael McFee.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel in court for State of Wisconsin. Cases 21CM144 and 22CF12.  PSI was filed and both parties noted no corrections.  State- no response for VRL.  Parties are free to argue for sentencing.  State argues sentencing.  Defense argues sentencing.  Def makes a statement.  See attached
Defendant's Sentencing Memorandum
Def is set up to appear by zoom from Stanley on Nov 4;  ka
Sentencing hearing on November 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

9:29 AM Defendant Jared Michael McFee appeared by video, in custody from Stanley Correctional.  Attorney Daniel Francis Snyder appeared by video for Jared Michael McFee.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 21CM144 and 22CF12.  Files contains PLQ, parties jointly recommending a PSI and free to argue, parties agree.  Def waiving right to personal appearance, discussed with attorney, attorney is satisfied, court satisfied knowingly, willingly, and voluntarily waiving right and accepts.  State has complied with victim rights, 22CF12 no response and 21CM144 does not apply.  Attorney and def admits he is a repeater.  Def understands counts and penalties.  Def PLEADS NO CONTEST to 21CM144 CT 1 and 22CF12 CT 1.  File contains PLQ, reviewed with attorney, understands information and rights giving up, and understands elements.  Attorney is satisfied.  Court is satisfied that def is knowingly, willingly, and voluntarily, and accepts NO CONTEST PLEAS, as a factual basis can court rely on information in the criminal compliant for each case, parties agree can rely on information in criminal compliant, court finds factual basis exists, finds GUILTY and direct judgment to enter on 21CM144 CT 1 and 22CF12 CT 1, any remaining counts are DRI.  Court orders PSI.  Def will still be in custody.  Attorney needs to let court know if wants to appear in person.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Email sent to Stanley Correctional advising def has court on July 28 at 9:30;  ka
Plea hearing on July 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Atty comments- faxed copy to Stanley and asked for Stanley to fax back, which they would not. Atty mailed self addressed stamped envelope. Went over PLQ with def and def mailed it back, but atty has not rec'd the PLQ. 
KA set def up to appr from Stanley
Plea hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:32 AM Defendant Jared Michael McFee appeared by video means from ACJ. Prosecuting Atty Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for State of Wisconsin. Heidi Brewer appeared for Def. (spec. app)  Covers cases 21CM144 and New Charges.  Unable to be served.  Ct. finds probable cause.  21CF102, 20CF53 and 17CF44 cases in WRC.  Last in WRC ct. on 8/11/21 of which Def left to go to residential treatment. Mailing address: 75510 Moccasin Dr.  Unemployed. No cases pend. Under supervision.  On hold.  State comments on bail/bond.  Asks for cash bail.  Def. Atty comments on bail/bond, mentions Def. is elig. Will assign councel. Req. lower cash bail.  Ct. sets cash bail at $3000.  NC with C.P. or address of 75583 Alder St. Odonah, WI. Warrant quashed.  Initial appearance scheduled for January 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
